Package soot.jimple.infoflow.taintWrappers

Class AbstractTaintWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.taintWrappers.AbstractTaintWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITaintPropagationWrapper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EasyTaintWrapper, IdentityTaintWrapper, RecordingTaintWrapper
    public abstract class AbstractTaintWrapper
extends Object
implements ITaintPropagationWrapper
    Abstract base class for all taint propagation wrappers
    Author:
    Steven Arzt

      Data flow manager that gives access to internal solver objects

      • AbstractTaintWrapper

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(InfoflowManager manager)
        Description copied from interface: ITaintPropagationWrapper
        This method is called before the taint propagation is started to give the taint wrapper the chance to initialize required components once Soot is running, but before it is queried for the first time. Note that this method is guaranteed to be called only once and only by a single thread.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Parameters:
        manager - The manager object providing access to the data flow solver processing the IFDS edges and the interprocedural control flow graph

      • getPreAnalysisHandlers

        public Collection<PreAnalysisHandler> getPreAnalysisHandlers()
        Description copied from interface: ITaintPropagationWrapper
        This method returns a PreAnalysisHandler that runs before the InfoflowManager creation. Use this method, for example, to inject hierarchy information.
        Specified by:
        getPreAnalysisHandlers in interface ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Returns:
        a collection of PreAnalysisHandlers. Assumed to be non-null.

      • isExclusiveInternal

        protected abstract boolean isExclusiveInternal​(soot.jimple.Stmt stmt,
                                               AccessPath taintedPath)
        Gets whether the taints produced by this taint wrapper are exclusive, i.e. there are no other taints than those produced by the wrapper. In effect, this tells the analysis not to propagate inside the callee.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The call statement to check
        taintedPath - The tainted field or value to propagate
        Returns:
        True if this taint wrapper is exclusive, otherwise false.

      • getTaintsForMethodInternal

        public abstract Set<AccessPath> getTaintsForMethodInternal​(soot.jimple.Stmt stmt,
                                                           AccessPath taintedPath)
        Checks an invocation statement for black-box taint propagation. This allows the wrapper to artificially propagate taints over method invocations without requiring the analysis to look inside the method.
        Parameters:
        stmt - The invocation statement which to check for black-box taint propagation
        taintedPath - The tainted field or value to propagate
        Returns:
        The list of tainted values after the invocation statement referenced in Stmt has been executed

      • isExclusive

        public boolean isExclusive​(soot.jimple.Stmt stmt,
                           Abstraction taintedPath)
        Description copied from interface: ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Gets whether the taints produced by this taint wrapper are exclusive, i.e. there are no other taints than those produced by the wrapper. In effect, this tells the analysis not to propagate inside the callee.
        Specified by:
        isExclusive in interface ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Parameters:
        stmt - The call statement to check
        taintedPath - The tainted field or value to propagate
        Returns:
        True if this taint wrapper is exclusive, otherwise false.

      • getTaintsForMethod

        public Set<Abstraction> getTaintsForMethod​(soot.jimple.Stmt stmt,
                                           Abstraction d1,
                                           Abstraction taintedPath)
        Description copied from interface: ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Checks an invocation statement for black-box taint propagation. This allows the wrapper to artificially propagate taints over method invocations without requiring the analysis to look inside the method.
        Specified by:
        getTaintsForMethod in interface ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Parameters:
        stmt - The invocation statement which to check for black-box taint propagation
        d1 - The abstraction at the beginning of the method that calls the wrapped method
        taintedPath - The tainted field or value to propagate
        Returns:
        The list of tainted values after the invocation statement referenced in Stmt has been executed

      • getWrapperHits

        public int getWrapperHits()
        Description copied from interface: ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Gets the number of times in which the taint wrapper was able to exclusively model a method call. This is equal to the number of times isExclusive() returned true.
        Specified by:
        getWrapperHits in interface ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Returns:
        The number of method model requests that succeeded

      • getWrapperMisses

        public int getWrapperMisses()
        Description copied from interface: ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Gets the number of times in which the taint wrapper was NOT able to exclusively model a method call. This is equal to the number of times isExclusive() returned false.
        Specified by:
        getWrapperMisses in interface ITaintPropagationWrapper
        Returns:
        The number of method model requests that failed
